CatDescriptText: Myrtle Goode, 823 First Avenue, Coraopolis, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 30, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "Does the financial aid, given young married couples by parents, encourage or dissuade the latter's realization of marital responsibilities?" Answer reads: "If the young married couple is of the age to be married, the help should not hinder them."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Myrtle Goode wearing a plaid scarf and gloves with fur trim, holding light colored handbag over left wrist, standing in front of marble pillar between store windows
